conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine the direction of motion from 2 to 3 seconds.
The graph shows velocity on the y-axis and time on the x-axis.
Positive values of velocity indicate motion in the defined positive direction.
Negative values of velocity indicate motion in the opposite direction.
At t = 2 seconds, the velocity is 0 m/s, indicating the particle is momentarily at rest.
From t = 2 seconds to t = 3 seconds, the velocity becomes negative, reaching -2 m/s at t = 3 seconds.
Since the velocity is negative between 2 and 3 seconds, the particle is moving in the opposite direction to the defined positive direction.
The motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
